titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Randell burial plot papers 1986.042
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:06 +0000.

did.abstract: One deed and supporting documentation regarding burial plots in Cypress Hills Cemetery purchased by William Randell (or Randall) of Newtown, Queens in 1864. William Randell, of the family after which Randall's Island in Manhattan is named, married into the prosperous Vanderveer family.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); William Randell burial plot papers, 1986.042, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
